nodes.bodyText:
It seems a bit weird to change the classpath in the system tests

I tend to agree with you in general but disagree in this specific case.
It's a well-known fact that JAXB(and some other libs) was removed from the JDK11.
It seems OK for me to explicitly add it to the classpath of the software that was developed when this lib was part of the JDK.
Please, see the link - https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/11-relnote-issues-5012449.html#JDK-8190378

Change the compatibility tests to exclude the older versions when executed with Java 11.

Do we need to check upgrade_test.py for 0.10 and 0.11?
I prepared the fix with the assumption that we still want to check all versions and upgrade scenarios.
Please, note, that 0.8 and 0.9 cases succeed without classpath fix.
It seems inconsistent for me if we will disable 0.10 and 0.11 cases but keep 0.9 and 0.8 checks enabled. Do you suggest disabling all upgrade checks prior 1.x version?
Please, let me know what do you think and I will prepare the fix.

nodes.bodyText: Could we have kafka_opts return the adjusted ops for the new jvm?

Hello, @ijuma
Can you, please, clarify your proposal?
I looked at kafka_opts values in the tests and it's usage in kafka-run-class.sh and doesn't get it. How should I adjust it and why?
Can you, please, give me an example of some wrong value of kafka_opts?

Hello @ijuma
Can you, please, explain your idea to me?
So I can fix this PR according to your requirements.

The function kafka_opts returns jvm options that don't work with certain JVM versions. I was suggesting that we could pass a node to it so that it returns the right jvm options. That way, we don't need to fix them after the fact. Does that makes sense?

Hello @ijuma
Can you, please, explain your proposal for kafka_opts one more time :)
I really want to fix it.
My bad. The unsupported options come directly from the shell scripts. You are overriding depending on the JVM version. Makes sense.

Thanks for the reply!
Is everything OK with the PR?
Should I additionally check some other tests?
